intro: Lindernia caespitosa, commonly known as the clustered lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Lindernia caespitosa is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
